references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Latent Diffusion Models, the architecture upon which Stable Diffusion is built, and as such is a core paper in the field.
This paper introduces Classifier-Free Guidance (CFG), which is a technique that makes it possible to train conditional diffusion models without a classifier network.

This paper introduces Diffusion Transformers (DiT), a more scalable and performant alternative to U-Net-based diffusion models, and represents an important improvement in diffusion model architecture.
This paper presents Denoising Diffusion Implicit Models (DDIM), a faster and more controllable class of iterative latent variable models with a non-Markovian diffusion process.

references.paper_title: Instructpix2pix: Learning to follow image editing instructions
references.reason: This paper presents InstructPix2Pix, a method that uses a diffusion model to edit images based on text instructions.
